turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes.  I do.  I want it to end now. Let her go.  I'll come -- just let her go.  She's not important.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: You know where.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Where it began -- McCluskey Auditorium.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Kill me, Peter, do it, now.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: No.  Not yet.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Do it.  If that's what all this carnage is about, then do it.  Have enough guts to do it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Don't talk to me about courage.  I know death, what it's like to kill. You're not a killer -- you watched Daryll Lee kill that cop and you didn't make a peep, because you were paralyzed with fear.  You chocked.  I know something <u>else</u> about you.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: We'll keep talking.  Until they get here.  Then...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I have no life anymore.  I ruined your life, make me pay for it.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Why did you do that?  Didn't you have any idea how hard it was for me, to get that far?  I worshipped you.  You inspired me.  I thought you could understand me the way you understood the others.  I knew that about you -- the ones you admired were the great murderers; they fascinated you.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That's not who I admire -- I admire people who are good at what they do, great artists, writers, thinkers...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: I don't have the talent for any of those things.  All I have a talent for is death.  And I am one of a kind.  What do you think of your student now?  I have made you famous, I am your creation and your monument.

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Oh, please.  I know what's coming, now.  "Let me help you..."

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Do anything you want to me.  I give myself to you.  Only put the knife down.  Isn't this what you always wanted?  I know it's what we all want, to love and to loved.  I could love you.  You could work together in some safe place, learn to really understand you, help you, give you some peace of mind, some happiness...

turns.speaker: PETER
turns.text: Back in the driver's seat again, Doctor?  That old dream -- study us to see what makes us sick.  So you can find a cure -- they'd name it after you?  Death is the only cure for people like me.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Who is this?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Inspector Halloran, Homicide.  I'm in charge here.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: No, ma'am.  This is no joke.  And neither is tying up telephone lines to police with crank calls while people in trouble are trying to get through for help.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You're calling me a crank?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Do you have any evidence to report, ma'am?  Do you know any of the victims...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I think this is number three...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: That's an opinion, not evidence...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Ring the gong, he goes.  Poor impulse control.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Is he out?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: If he's not out, why are they here?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Because of your phone calls.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What calls?  I haven't made any calls.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I want to tell you it's a great honor to meet you and talk to you.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You don't admire me.  No police admire me.  I got one of you killed.  Why don't you say right out what you're here for?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: <u>You</u> called <u>us</u>, Doctor Hudson.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes, I did.  Poor impulse control. The accounts of the firs two murders made it so clear they were the work of the same man, but you kept announcing they were unrelated.  You'll never catch him that way.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Sugar and cream for Goetz; I take mine black.  You're absolutely correct.  The politicians don't want panic headlines spoiling the Festival of Love.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Well, let's thank God you and Inspector Goetz are on the case, then.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Would you want to work with us on this?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Oh, my God, no!  I'm a clinical hysteric, with panic syndrome, and anxiety neurosis, agoraphobic, I'm afraid of everything, real and imaginary.  I never leave this apartment now.  Nobody ever comes here.  I just wanted to get your attention.  I write and I used to lecture on these crimes, but... I'm not competent.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I think you are.  I really admire everything you've done; it would be an honor to work with you, and we need all the help we can get, especially yours.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Inspector Halloran, that is so much bullshit, you don't like or admire me, but the beautiful part is I don't give a fuck.  That's the upside of having a breakdown.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Well, it's a hell of an apartment you got here.  I'm living one step away from the projects, myself, but I get to go to work every day, wading in blood and guts.  I guess the books you wrote about these sons of bitches paid off pretty good.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Will you go.  Andy, make them go.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: You can't go out lecturing?  Tough shit.  Women are dying.  Where can I lay this stuff out?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Is it an ongoing case?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: For months... last October.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It was a lover or a husband. Someone close.  Somebody who knew her and cared about her.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: How do you know that?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He felt remorse.  He covered her.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: The bodies have been carefully arranged... different positions, but somehow the same.  The positions are brutal... yet quite... artful.  It's like... a signature.  He's proud of his accomplishments.  There are early Picassos and late Picassos, but you always recognize the hand.  He wants us to recognize <u>his</u> hand. I've seen this hand before... what are you hiding?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Where are the stockings he strangled them with?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: How did you know they were stockings?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I sent Andy out on murder missions. For God's sake -- it's the Boston Strangler, Alber deSalvo.  He used their own stockings to strangle them.  Tied in a bow-knot.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Why imitate a dead serial killer?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: If you knew why, you might know where to look for him. I don't envy you this; he's not done -- he's going to do them faster and faster to keep the adrenaline rush.  Now, I've done what you asked me.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Work with me.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: How do you know that?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Look at the bottom of the screen. You see the icon with the arrow pointing left?  Click on that... twice.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Can you make a copy we can show on our computers?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's too big a file to copy to a disk.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I'm going to put a guard on your door.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: One officer already got killed trying to protect me.  Please, just take it all away.  Leave me alone.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: <u>He</u> won't.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: We'll show that to...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Show what?  It's gone.  He wrote a self destruct virus into the code, so it would only play until we try to copy it.  Then it erased itself. Gone...  Do you remember what you saw?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I am not going to look at any more pictures.  They're like a disease. They get into my head.  I can't get them out.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I don't look at pictures.  I look at the <u>real thing</u>.  I don't feel infected.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Maybe that's why you can't catch him.  I <u>know</u> what she looks like -- the red-headed woman in my computer.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I just came from her... here's what you haven't seen.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: She probably let him in the door without a thought.  Where are their mothers?!  Where are the mothers that are supposed to teach them to be wary and to tough and not afraid to fight?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Look at the sign.  'Hell'?  In the Festival of Love?  You make any sense in that?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's <u>anybody</u> connected to author- ity.  They write, they even knock on your door.  They're <u>fans</u>.  It thrills them to flirt with getting caught.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Nobody knows you have anything to do with this case; nothing has been on TV or the news... Why would he want to get in <u>your</u> computer?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Because I'm his damned pin-up girl! His, all of them!  They know me. They're in prisons with libraries, they collect clippings, I'm their worthy opponent.  You keep my name out of this.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: That's amazing.  A whole new book, thought up in a minute.  Very good.  All I know how t do is get up, take a shower, and go to work. Hope, if he does another I'll nail the son of bitch, and they'll spell my name right in the newspaper. Where is Andy going?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He's going home.  He slept over because I was a little anxious...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I want a guard on you.  I'm worried about leaving you alone.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: We've got another one.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That's no surprise.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: But it's a different m.o.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Then what do you need me for?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: She was killed somewhere else and dumped outdoors in an empty lot. Where it says "no dumping."  Her legs pulled apart in a kind of sexual pose.   It's all different but it seems so -- the same. Artificial and <u>posed</u>... Something's wrong with it.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You're saying it's the same man, but he's changed his style?  That doesn't happen.  These men are robotic; the murder is like a ritual.  The method itself is part of the pleasure...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Who turned off the Internet computer...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I turned it off.  It's like an open window he can climb right in...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: He comes in the window, we maybe grab him.  Where's the on-switch?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Have you got a warrant?  Get the hell out o here!  This is the <u>only space I have left in the</u> <u>world</u>!  Why can't you leave me out of it?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Helen -- the killer directly contacted you.  His interest in you is <u>intense</u>.  I'm worried about you. I don't want to lose you.  I know this stirs up every monster under the bed, but this is the only direct contact we have with him. The only chance we have to trap him.  So, you can turn Internet back on, or I do, and we put somebody here on a 24 hour shift and you can kick, scream and hyperventilate.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That little Winona Ryder manner... you're more convincing as Clint Eastwood.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Clint is putting a guard on you. But if you swear to leave the computer on, Winona will assign him to the hall outside.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Ruben.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Hello, Ruben...  So that's that...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Please thank Inspector Goetz for taking care of me last night.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: There were needle marks.  But no drugs in her blood.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: So far nothing they test for comes up positive.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Is that it?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: That's exactly... I could have taken that same picture, this morning.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: That's not consistent... You said they never changed their style, they're robots...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Consistency is the hobgoblin of <u>little</u> minds.  Tell them to test for the chemicals found in Windex. That's a product for cleaning with...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I know Windex, for God's sake, I clean my own windows...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's what Bianchi and Buono injected into one of their victims.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Injected Windex!  Why would he switch to a new m.o.?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Ah, if you knew that, you'd be half way to nailing him.  Serial killing is irrational and rigid and compulsive.  This guy has a plan all thought out, flexible and complex.  He's playing a game with us.  Who will he imitate next? Maybe he's doing all the serial killers in history, the great innovators, the murderers' hall of fame.  Just to prove he's better than all of them.  They got caught; he didn't.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: He'll get caught.  If he has a plan that'll be what trips him up...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Who's going to catch him?  You?  And if you do, there'll be another one.  And one after that.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: You're afraid of him.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: This one, yes.  I was always curious about these twisted little souls, but this is the first one I've felt personally terrified of. He's something new and unheard of. I don't know what he wants.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I'm giving you Clint outside.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Halloran.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You betrayed me!  Now every psychopath in the city knows I'm back in business... You lied to me!

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I did not; the Mouth -- that's what we call Susan Schiffer -- got it on her own.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Why should I trust you?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Because I'm all you've got.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Helen, hang up, let Ruben get on with his work...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What's that music.  It's Abba.  I can hear it.  It's Abba.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: What's that siren?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: One of those goddamned car alarms. What's going...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Ruben's gone to look... It's banged up but it looks like a .44.  It's Son of Sam.  Is it Son of Sam?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Look in the crowd.  He liked to hang around and watch the cops at work...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: They put  Merry <u>Saks</u> on it?!

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: He said to send you his regards and to tell you that the Bureau holds you in the highest esteem.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What I can't believe is that in an earlier life I slept with him! Christ!  Any God that loved his people would give women a rewind on their life and an erase button.  Just give me a minute here.  The letter is addressed to me...  You don't feel fear, do you? You're young.  You feel like you'll live forever.  How wonderful.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I put my ass on the line, giving you that.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: They weren't going to show it to me?!  The arrogance!  It's my <u>life</u>!

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: It's also the major piece of evidence, and it makes you a key part of his plan.  You can't run away from it anymore.  Look at the order he's doing them... He did three as the Boston Strangler just to tell us a copycat serial killer was at work.  Then he did one like the Hillside Strang- ler.  And then one as Son of Sam. To lead us on -- to where and what end?  And he's doing more than that -- he's imitating each killer's method as closely as he can -- in details.  Injecting Windex.  Using .44.  Playing Abba.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's not chronological: Son of Sam was before Hillside.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: '...great dark hall of fame... all our greatest killers...'  His greatest <u>heroes</u>?  He wants to be famous.  When they're caught and people like me write about them, we give them a kind of immortality. They get thousands of letters. Ramirez kills eight women and gets a hundred marriage proposals a month.  They're like film stars.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: They get fan letters...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Let's speed up the game plan... call all the living serials to ask if they've had contact with a Peter Kurten.  We could use some help on the phones...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: They're not talking to me.  Saks looks right through me.  I ask him for some bodies, for the phones -- he's so encouraging: "you make that <u>your</u> little job."  Condescending bastard.  Helen, on your lists to call is San Quentin.  Daryll Lee Cullum?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You do that one, I don't want it...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What happened to you?!

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Ruben's dead.   So stupid, a cop thing, a crazy kid and a buncha dumb mistakes... I'm sorry... because you and he...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I just thought it was so -- unprofessional.  Of you both!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He felt sorry for me.  It was so nice to flirt.  He was a darling man.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: A man?  I thought he was a boy.  This last Christmas was the happiest Christmas I had in the last ten years... you know why?  It was the first Christmas in six years I was not in love.  Son of a bitch <u>married men</u>!  Who cares about marriage, the bed just gets crowded and noisy?!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You're exhausted.  Let me get you a brandy.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Where's the john?  Let me clean up this mess, and get back to work.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Who's the married man?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: What does it matter?  This guy, you checked your course records, who signed up?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: The University computer is down for maintenance, but I've been going through my own notes...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Look.  There's the order:  you wrote it:  DeSalvo, Bianchi & Buono, Berkowitz and Dahmer.  It's going to be Dahmer next.  Which means he'll kill a man.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Yes.  Dahmer!  And after that...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Bundy.  That's the last one in your speech...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Maybe you should...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I'm working on it!  It's what I do.  Quinn...Halloran.  I'll wait.  Where's Andy, can we get some coffee in here?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Out.  Where does he go?  Nowhere. What does he do?  Nothing.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I am not going to talk about it. How do you <u>know</u> it was Andy if the head was gone?  Where is the head? Are you looking for it?  Oh, God, why him?  Because of me.  I can't talk about it.  I write about things like this, stuff it all in books and bury it in libraries. This is the first person close to me who's ever died.  And it's because of me.  This monster killed him because I loved him.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I've got to go.  I've <u>got</u> to go.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: How many do you need to sleep. Really sheep?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: W-We had a fight.  I called him... called him a name...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Christ, Helen.  The first time, we're ahead of the son of a bitch! I can't leave you like this -- and there's no time.  Knock yourself out.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Helen.  I saw him die.  I saw him burning on the basement stairs, he never reached the top.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: They never kill themselves.  How do you know it was him.  You never met him.  You never even saw a photograph...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Helen -- let go.  You've got to let go.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He hasn't done Bundy.  He's done every one of the others, hasn't he? If there are three dead Chi Omega college girls tomorrow, how will you feel?  Go there.  See if there could be any way for him to escape.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: This has been the worst 48 hours of my life.  I'm going home.  I'm going to try to get drunk.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: If there's a one percent possibil- ity, can you live with yourself when he kills again?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Oh, shut up, and don't be so damn self righteous.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Why can't I drive home?  I will. You.  Look at you.  <u>You</u> need a ride home.  And you don't even know it.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Well, thanks.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You were the one that talked about moonbikes and called me a crank? Oh God, I <u>am</u>!  Make them some coffee.  Halloran, is it?  Investigator Goetz?  I had a crank call myself-- he said...  I thought it might be Daryll Lee Cullum.  I thought he might be out of prison.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Daryll Lee Cullum?  I don't think so.  If he's escaped we'd have the National Guard, cops'd be crawling through sewers.  You'd have a guard on your front door.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I don't want this.  What are they?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: You called us, Doctor, if you don't want to look at them here, how about downtown.  I'll drive you down...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Somebody is imitating his m.o. Look for a plumber or carpenter or handyman; that's how deSalvo got in the door and caught them off guard.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: The Boston Strangler, when was that...?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: In the sixties.  He's dead -- stabbed to death in prison.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That computer's wired into INTERNET.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: He's hacked into her Internet address.  He's a hacker.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He can get into my computer any time he likes!  This is exactly the kind of thing I didn't want to have happen.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's a game they like to play. Berkowitz -- "Son of Sam" -- hung around the crime scene, talking to the cops.  This one's probably watching <u>you</u>, laughing at you.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Let me get a little action started here.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's gone.  The file's not here.  What did you do?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: I just started it copying to tape, but the tape never ran.  It just did that...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He's brilliant.  This one is brilliant.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I know 'Halloran.'  What's the rest of it?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: MaryJane.  We call her M.J.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: MaryJane.  You think that logic and police procedure, order and science and method will hold back the horrors of a world gone mad and the sickness of the night.  I did once. But you know how he'll get caught? He'll have an accident, or some cop will get lucky.  You can't catch him by being intelligent and working hard.  Or the worst:  there are dozens of women slaughtered in the most horrible way, month after month.  The news stories grow more grotesque and bizarre and in the city people lock their doors and windows, and hurry home before dark.  And then, one day, there are no more.  What happened?  Did he just stop?  Get tired and disgusted and decide not to kill any more? Did he kill himself?  Did he die in an auto accident?  Or a fight.  Or get sick and die?  It's like the murderer walked off the edge of the earth.  And you never know.  But you keep asking yourself -- when you read about a new murder -- is he back?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: We're through for the night, aren't we?  You go on.  Get some sleep. I'll stay until we can get a man out here and maybe catch a cab home.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: That would be much appreciated. Thanks.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: You and MaryJane aren't lovers.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Are you always so bold?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: No.  I'm shy and I'm selective.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: The problem for me is... you're in the witness category.  Know what I mean?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Well.  Another time, then.  I'll be all right.  He's not going to attack me; what I' m rally afraid of is all in my own head, Ruben.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Tell me what to do!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: I'm falling!  I'm going to fall!

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Don't let go... I can't breathe... I'll die!

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Shhh.  It's okay.  Just breathe. I'll fix it...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: The lock...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: I'll get a locksmith.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Will you stay?  Please?  I'm afraid to sleep... I don't want...<u>him</u>...in my head...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: It's a woman shot in a car?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Yes.  I have to go...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: She on the passenger side?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Don't hang up!

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: <u>What</u>?...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Listen to me.  Is there a gas station nearby?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Is there a phone booth there?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: They all have one...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Go and look for a note.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Open the door.  Please.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Why don't you shoot off the lock?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He was in my apartment!

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: I know, baby.  I know.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: You know how to use this?

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: They taught me at the FBI.  I was very good at it.  It scared me... I liked it.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: You take it, hang on to it, it'll make you feel safer.  Stay put.

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: What else?

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: Ma'am, please get out of your vehicle...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: Merry, how... oh, Christ, of course, you had my phone tapped.

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: Just get out of your vehicle...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He's got Sergeant Halloran in there.  He'll kill her the minute he sees or hears your people...

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: You've been very useful, Doctor, we appreciate all you've done, and now the professional will take over...

turns.speaker: HELEN
turns.text: He wants me, he doesn't care about her.  Let me...

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: Hello.  I am  Meryhew Saks.  The song is called "Murder By Numbers."  The performers are a group called The Police.  Adam here... ... from Behavioral Science is working out exactly what this perpetrator is trying to telegraph in the note.  This is an extremely complex case, and we have a lot of fancy theories floating around. We're not ruling out the possib- ility of three Copycat serial killers.  We have Quantico working on graphology, the Washington lap is cloning DNA from the secretor. It's our feeling that the best lead we have is the two sperm samples in one of the victims.  We have a team sweeping sperm banks.  Now I want to say a few word to you local people.  Your Commissioner asked for our assistance.  The Bureau does not send us in on these cases to lord it over the local police. We couldn't catch up on what you people know if we had a year.  We have nation-wide resources and hard state of the art forensic science; you have the local savvy.  Together we can be unbeatable.  Which one is Inspector Halloran?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Over here.

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: We don't see too many lady homicide detectives.  You have <u>my</u> respect. Have you discussed the note with Dr. Hudson?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Someone broke into her place last night.  It wasn't connected to our case, but it shook her up pretty bad so I haven't...

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: I was just about to advise the Inspector here not to show Dr. Hudson the note.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Sir, Doctor Hudson and I see a pattern develop...

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: We know Helen.  She's not exactly a credible collaborator.  Especially late in the day...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: She takes tranquilizers her doctor prescribes.

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: Who prescribes the brandy?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: How come you're so up on Dr. Hudson?

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: She is a writer, writing best selling books about serial killing. Giving lectures she's well-paid for.  Her interests are not the interests of law enforcement.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Okay.

turns.speaker: SAKS
turns.text: We've put a tap on Dr. Hudson's phone.  I know you won't mention it.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: I was.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I'm over here?  What's your name, Officer?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Michael Johnson.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: You touch anything, Mike?  Pick up anything?  Use the doorknob?  I don't want to find your prints on anything later and you tell me you forgot to tell me.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: No.  I didn't.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Whatever it is, I'm gonna find out and sooner is a hell of lot better than later.

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Well, there's something missing in there.  There was something around her neck when I came in there, but it's gone now.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Who came in after you?

turns.speaker: MIKE
turns.text: Lieutenant  Quinn.

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: What am I wasting my time with this shit for?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Because it's your job, that's all.

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: Not what I meant; why <u>me</u>?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Maybe it's something you did in this life, Nikko...

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: Working late.  You're a damn fool.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Oh, I know.

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: It's none of my business anymore...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: You got that right, Nikko, it's none of your business.

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: You're shitting ion your career.  You outrank hi...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Well, you outranked <u>me</u>, Nikko.

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: Yeah.  And you used that. Used <u>me</u>

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Don't put yourself down like that. I <u>never</u> used you.  I worked my way up like a marine grunt!

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: Yeah, you did that too.  You earned what you got; don't shit on it, that's all I'm saying.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: God, you're cute when you're mad.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: If this is just the dump site, where did he do the job?  Where did he pick her up?

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: Doped up kids all over town.  Park was full of them last night.  Very easy pickin'.  Goetz's type.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Quinn will be here any minute.  What are you going to say?

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: Christ.  I didn't lock the fucking drawer!  You spend twenty years thinking some perp's gonna whack you... you'll crash your car... but what happens is, you fuck yourself...  You can't imagine how many times I saw you two... your head together, I wish him dead.  Every time... Want to hear something weird?  I feel like I'd give my life to bring him back.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: You're in terrible trouble, Nikko.

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: Who gives a fuck?  In all the years I never seen you cry.  You loved him.

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: I heard. Good police work.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Just horseshit luck.

turns.speaker: NIKKO
turns.text: Don't ever forget how good you are.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: My third grade teacher at the convent shot better than that.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Yeah, but she had divine guidance.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Answer it.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: I'm sure she thinks it is.  Aren't you at least interested in which one it is?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: You're good enough you'll never have to kill anyone.  I joined the cops to save lives, not waste them.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: You know, M.J., when I watch you shoot, I realize I've got a little problem with my stance... could you just move over here and critique my legs?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Get Mercer to run the medical, dental, legal bills, laundry and dry cleaning receipts, extermin- ators, mailmen, grocery and drugstore deliveries, handymen, plumbers...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: It's mostly done, they got nobody in common, the three of them... No mutual friends -- the Landlady says nobody was ever there, she never saw her with anybody.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Snotty neurotic bitch...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Classy madonna.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Sure.  She likes <u>you</u>, Rube.  She likes the way you move.  She sure as hell isn't in love with me.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: You came in there with this attitude...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Order Chinese for us and meet me the library?  Anything but beef.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: He's just mad he let me keep the espresso machine.  We heard from Doctor Hudson?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Nada.  Lemme make the call.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Honest to God, Ruben!

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: I like women like that!

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Tell it to your shrink.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: You said you don't give a fuck and that's the beauty of a breakdown? This doesn't look like not giving a fuck, you know that?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Let's get out of here...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: You got a tape backup, yeah, here lemme copy it on tape...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Why would he send this to Helen Hudson...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Absolutely.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: My promise.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Is Niccoletti <u>assigned</u> here?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Quinn decided we should form a task force -- they're all one case, now. He wants all the senior detectives on it...  She wasn't killed here.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: She didn't fight back, no hair or skin under her fingernails.  I'm not seeing any bruises or contusions...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: What about her arms?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Needle marks, fresh, here.  look at this...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: She's blue as hell.  No marks on her neck.  Asphyxiated?  not the same -- no ligature marks.  Outdoors...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Look at her legs.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Spread out like she was sexually assaulted here.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Ruben, my God, I ought to put you on report.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: You're right.  I can't stand that bastard.  Sorry.  This is something new.  Not the same guy, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Yeah, everything's different.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Get the pictures, and casts of footprints.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Look at him, grandstanding...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Now listen up, Ruben.  You never, never, never mess with somebody <u>inside</u> the case!

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Excuse me?  <u>Excuse me</u>?!  What do you...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: You damn well better start working on that impulse control.  A woman who is implicated in this case? Someone who's practically a piece of <u>evidence</u>?

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: It's against your rules that I try to help a witness who's scared shitless?  Who's...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: The woman's unstable.  You could wind up with a harassment charge. <u>Anything</u>.  You're like some horny little teenager.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: What's Abba?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Bunch of Swedish women.  You're too young.

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: She wants me to check the phone booth for a note.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Helen... excuse me, we...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: The woman was in shock.  She was totally out on ranks.  I stayed because I didn't want her to wake up alone in a place where she'd just been under attack.  Stop that, you son of a bitch!  The place wasn't secure.  I was doing my goddamn job!  And, for the <u>second time</u>, I slept in her living room.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Don't try to lie, Ruben.  You don't have the face for it.  I need you to help interrogate the burglar in Hudson's place...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: Talk to Nikko...!

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: I'll talk to Conrad myself.  I'll be in the jail when you wind this up...

turns.speaker: RUBEN
turns.text: I gotta get something to eat, I haven't eaten all day.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: You messed with the scene.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: I tagged the goddamned stocking. It ain't lost.  We're sequestering that evidence.  That's the trap some son of a bitch is going to fall into...

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Am I in charge of this thing?  Or not.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: I said you were...

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: You didn't say serial killer and I didn't say serial killer.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: This is the anniversary of the summer of love and your city fathers have declared a Festival of Love.  The Mayor and Chamber of Commerce don't want TV announcing killers on the loose.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: We're gonna have a bunch of clapped out old hippies blissing on the Grateful Dead!  Sleeping in the park, smoking dope and sticking tulips up their ass.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Good.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: There was no sperm.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: The same as the firs two. Definitely a serial.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: What are you looking at that for? Helen Hudson.  Work the clues.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: What clues?  I'm going to work Helen Hudson.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: Would you step outside, Sergeant?

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: I'm <U>telling</u> you.  Don't you <u>ever</u> address me publicly in that tone. You'll work what and <u>who</u> I tell you to work.

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: Anybody in this department ever worked a serial killer case?  She's the expert.  I need help.

turns.speaker: QUINN
turns.text: How about I put Nikko on it?

turns.speaker: M.J.
turns.text: That's always your privilege, sir.
